home.text1: Handle the Configuration of profiles and available subsystems that provide a certain set of capabilities, such as datasources or messaging.
home.text2: Add, remove, and assign Deployments to server groups.
home.text3: View Runtime information such as server status, JVM usage, and server logs. In a managed domain, configure hosts and server groups.

profiles.text1: A profile is a collection of subsystems along with each subsystemâ€™s configurations. A subsystem is an additional set of capabilities added to the core server by an extension.
profiles.text2: Different profiles can be defined to address the specific needs of different server groups.

serverGroups.text1: A server group is a set of server instances that will be configured and managed as one.
serverGroups.text2: All server instances within a server group use the same profile and have the same deployment content.

servers.text1: A server represents an application server instance.
servers.text2: In a managed domain, all server instances are members of a server group. The host controller launches each server instance in its own JVM process.

deployments.text1: A deployment is any resource, such as a WAR or EAR application, that can be deployed to a server.
deployments.text2: In a managed domain, deployments are assigned to server groups. All server instances within a server group will have the same deployment content.

configuration.text1: List of profiles available in the managed domain. Different server groups can use different profiles depending on the capabilities needed.
configuration.text2: View and modify the configuration for each subsystem included in the selected profile. For example, add a datasource, configure a messaging provider, or set up application security.

serverGroups.text1: View server group configuration and perform operations such as starting, stopping, and reloading all servers in this server group.
serverGroups.text2: Create a new server group for the managed domain.
serverGroups.text3: List of servers that belong to the selected server group.

servers.text1: Manage servers by hosts or server groups in the managed domain.
servers.text2: View server configuration and perform operations such as starting, stopping, and reloading the server.
servers.text3: Create a new server for a host and assign to a server group.
servers.text4: View runtime information about the server, such as JVM usage and server logs.

deployments.text1:
Add deployments and assign them to server groups from Content Repository, where all deployment content is listed.

Assign deployments to server groups from Unassigned Content for those deployments that have not been assigned to any server groups.

Add and enable deployments from Server Groups for those deployments that have been assigned to one or more server groups.
deployments.text2: Add a deployment to a server group by uploading a new deployment, choosing an existing deployment from the content repository, or creating an unmanaged deployment to be managed outside of WildFly.
